title: NixOS Package PRs for nmap, xclip, libcap-2.68, fishplugin-fzf.fish, cmake, pinentry-1.2.1 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for nmap, xclip, libcap-2.68, fishplugin-fzf.fish, cmake, pinentry-1.2.1 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

cmake uses CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH to search for libraries, header files, binaries, cmake modules, etc. This is mostly fine except for binaries. We set CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH to the derivation output locations, which results in cmake finding and using binaries which are not set in PATH. when strictDeps is true, nativeBuildInputs is not added to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH but buildInputs so binaries are first searched for in the buildInputs packages before falling back to PATH.

This change attempts to fix the cmake search path such that cmake will only locate binaries accessible via PATH.

the following PRs fix various packages that enable strictDeps but fail to build due to packages missing from nativeBuildInputs

  • #324545
  • #324951
  • #329977

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin

    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true

items.title: cmake:  fix strictDeps

items.content_html:
Description of changes

strict deps doesn't quite work for cmake as it pulls in buildInputs into the PATH. this change uses a fix for cmake #318226 so this doesn't happen and then fixes the packages that set strict deps but broke with the fixed cmake.

there were a couple of lomiri packages where i just disabled strict deps due to how cmake would package scripts, it seemed to want to locate them in the PATH and then package them. I could've just added them to nativeBuildInputs but i didn't -- think there are only 2 packages -- will revisit.

kdePackages.* has lots of breakages for strict deps and there are around 400 packages to go thru I think that perhaps they should just disable strict deps when cmake gets fixed and then re-enable as the packages get fixed.

packages were found using:

cmake-strict-deps.nix 
nix-instantiate --show-trace --eval --strict --json -A devs - <<EOF
{
  paths ? (import ./pkgs/top-level/release-attrpaths-superset.nix { }).paths,
  pkgs ? (import ./. { }),
}:

let
  inherit (pkgs) lib;
  inherit (builtins) currentSystem tryEval;

  usesCmake =
    let
      hasCmakeNativeBuildInputs =
        p: p ? nativeBuildInputs && lib.lists.any (x: x == pkgs.cmake) p.nativeBuildInputs;

      usesCmake' =
        p:
        p != null
        && p.strictDeps or false
        && !(p.meta.broken or false)
        && lib.meta.availableOn p currentSystem
        && hasCmakeNativeBuildInputs p;
    in
    path: (tryEval (usesCmake' (lib.attrByPath path null pkgs))).value;
in
{
  devs = map (f: lib.concatStringsSep "." f) (lib.filter usesCmake paths);
}
EOF

items.title: cmake: 3.29.6 -> 3.30.1

items.content_html:
Rewriting /usr and /opt to /var/empty is no longer necessary since the sandbox was introduced. It also introduced unexpected side effects and changes paths like $out/etc/opt/ to $out/etc/var/empty/

Closes #24215

items.title: cmake: 3.29.6 -> 3.30.0

items.content_html:
Description of changes

#245527 PR author ran into the issue (#144170) where many programs expect CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR & co. to be a relative path, but NixOS sets it to an absolute path. Fedora used to do the same until 2012, but ran into the same issue so it doesn't do that anymore.

Leaving aside whether this should be reconsidered like Fedora did, the #245527 PR author saw the warning about //nix being in a .pc file, so they fixed the code to use CMAKE_INSTALL_FULL_LIBDIR. This got rid of the warning, but the .cmake files still contained //nix. This PR adds a warning for }//nix in .cmake files as well (maybe //nix check would make more sense since it's comparatively less likely that it would be }//nix in .cmake files).

items.title: cmake: make check-pc-files hook also check .cmake files

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Summary

Provide structural attributes support to the setup hooks of CMake and lint them with ShelllCheck.

Fix #289037.

### New interface

Provide interface to structurally specify CMake -D flags, i.e. cmakeDFlagAttrs and cmakeDFlagEvalAttrs. Not only can it be specified by phases/hooks run before cmakeConfigurePhase, but also as Nix Language attributes when __structuralAttrs = true.

Update: The interface change is hold back here, and will be discussed in a subsequent PR.

Questions

  • Naming.
    • Any suggestions to the new names cmakeDFlagAttrs and cmakeDFlagEvalAttrs?
  • Boolean and non-string type management.
    • Should we allow boolean and other non-string type when cmakeDFlagAttrs is used inside the Nix Language expression? That would be quite convenient in Nix expression level, but require an extra layer of conversion. This PR currently doesn't provide such support.

Things done

items.title: cmake: add __structuredAttrs support to setup hooks

items.content_html:
• Fix a couple typos
  • Capitalize CMake, Ninja, and Make when used as project names
  • Clarify that CMAKE_ environment variable setting cannot be disabled
  • Explain why it is sufficient to override configurePhase
  • Explain how Ninja comes into play in a CMake project
  • Note the interaction between the Ninja and CMake setup hooks for disabling
    purposes
items.title: Documentation improvements for the CMake infrastructure

items.content_html:
Description of changes

duckdb: fix cross build

  • only run tests if stdenv.buildPlatform.canExecute stdenv.hostPlatform
  • Set DUCKDB_EXPLICIT_PLATFORM for cross builds to prevent duckdb from compiling and running a program to collect system information.

duckdb: specify duckdb non-standard cmake install paths

duckdb uses non-standard cmake variables to specify where to install the artifacts so specify them in the derivation. this fixes the paths in the generated $dev/lib/cmake/*.cmake files to point to $lib rather than $out.

duckdb: remove jdbc, use cmakeBool, darwin deployment target

  • JDBC was dropped in 0.10.3. remove the assiciated build flags.
  • switch some build flags to use cmakeBool
  • set darwin deployment target. it defaults to 11 and x64 darwin uses 10.2

duckdb,python311Packages.duckdb: get git sha from tarball not update script

duckdb build requires the git sha-1. The sha is now extracted from the tarball by decompressing the first 4k and passing the result to git get-tar-commit-id. This replaces the update script which used the github api to map a version to a sha which was then imported into the derivation.

duckdb: move to by-name

duckdb,python311Packages.duckdb: add paparodeo to maintainers

items.title: rocmPackages.rocm-cmake: 6.0.2 -> 6.1.0

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Hi, I need help with this.

Out standing issues:

  1. Am I doing the right thing to build a cmake subdir that's not included in the parent project?
  2. Any suggestions on what to do about the utils binaries? They link against the local relative path to libtypec, which is incorrect and fails the reference check at the end of the build.

Init libtypec at 0.4.0.

project url: https://github.com/Rajaram-Regupathy/libtypec
description:

‚Äúlibtypec‚Äù is aimed to provide a generic interface abstracting all platform complexity for user space to develop tools for efficient USB-C port management. The library can also enable development of diagnostic and debug tools to debug system issues around USB-C/USB PD topology.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

Priorities

Add a üëç reaction to pull requests you find important.
items.title: wip: libtypec: init at 0.5.0 (cmake help needed)

items.content_html:
The current version of osqp does appends the install prefix twice which does not allow for downstream packages to use cmake.

Description of changes

remove the redundant install prefix.

Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: osqp: fix cmake config install path for headers

items.content_html:
CMake implicitly runs a compiler test when it detects a new project. This normally compiles a minimal executable and runs it. In case of cross-compilation it still attempts to build an executable but not execute it.

When cross-compiling to a None platform, this will fail for all CMake packages since executables cannot be built and the user is forced to override this manually through overlays.

This commit changes CMake's behavior when cross compiling to a None platform so that it compiles a static library as a test instead.

Description of changes

Add CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE=STATIC_LIBRARY to cmakeFlags.

Things done

Checked change with a large set of custom and builtin CMake libraries while cross-compiling to arm-none-eabi target
items.title: Disable compiler runtime-test for cmake when cross-compiling to None platform.
